Chapter 61

◎Second Update◎

Not to mention how affectionate Huiyin and Li Cheng were, Xie Jiuyi and Yin Liyi also got along very well. The couple often had late-night conversations. Xie Jiuyi said, "You should visit your sister more often these days. As the mother of the Prince of Yuzhang, they say that with a new ruler comes a new court. The Prince of Yuzhang is still young, so I ask her to take extra care."

"There's no need for you to say that; I would definitely go," Yin Liyi replied happily, as her husband had sent Cao Ping’s sister away. Whether Cao Ping’s sister was sincere or not, she had always made her uneasy.

Xie Jiuyi noticed that his wife had become more cheerful and considered this a double success. He had never liked Cao Ping’s sister, who posed a threat to his wife. He had handed over the businesses in Nanjun, Yuzhang, and half of Jianye to the Cao family, returned Cao Ping’s sister’s dowry, and even arranged a new marriage proposal for her. The Cao family had agreed to this arrangement.

However, he did not tell Yin Liyi much about these secret matters, only saying that he did not like Cao Ping’s sister and did not want to waste her youth. Nevertheless, Yin Liyi felt guilty and sent Cao Ping’s sister a generous gift of silks and jewelry.

"Well, although the Prince of Wei is gone now, the people below are restless, and the biggest threat is the Crown Prince," Xie Jiuyi remarked worriedly.

Yin Liyi, of course, understood but felt helpless. "People really do change. The Crown Prince wasn't like this before. He didn't have much desire."

Xie Jiuyi said, "He didn't have any before because his wings weren't fully grown. But now that he has married the daughter of Zheng Fang, occupied several territories, and commands the navy in Poyang and Huai-Si, how could he not have ambitions now? These people have all defected to him, and we've been left out."

"What about Dongting Lake?" Yin Liyi asked anxiously.

Xie Jiuyi patted her hand. "Though I’ve placed people there, it’s not nearly as effective as when the Crown Prince was in charge. You don’t know how capable he is, especially in training naval forces. You must understand that Prince Wei had genuinely valued the Crown Prince and taught him everything he knew, only to find out that he had other intentions."

Yin Liyi was also anxious, but Xie Jiuyi didn't want to worry his wife. "Don't worry, I'll take care of these things. As for the Cao family, I'll handle them too. You don't need to worry."

Although her husband said this, Yin Liyi still felt uneasy. The next day, when she went to see her elder sister Yin Lifang, she expressed her concerns.

"Sister, I always feel that everything is changing too quickly. Please don't laugh at me, but I still don’t believe the Crown Prince is driven by greed," Yin Liyi said, reminiscing about their childhood.

Seeing her sister like this, Yin Lifang, who had always been gentle, now had a hint of disdain in her expression. "Why do you always remember your childhood? I wonder if you still have feelings for the Crown Prince. He secretly took over the late prince's territories, all while bullying us, a widow and orphans."

Yin Lifang usually spoke very appropriately, but ever since Li Cheng humiliated her, she had only felt hatred towards him. She had told her sister about this, but it was as if Yin Liyi didn't understand at all, always bringing up childhood memories.

Yin Liyi wasn't angry but just frustrated. "Sister, what are you saying? I'm just sighing."

"Alright, alright, it's my fault," Yin Lifang said, realizing that she shouldn't have spoken to her sister like that. Changing the subject, she asked, "How are you doing now? After Cao Ping’s sister left, is your mother-in-law still the same?"

Yin Liyi smiled. "Yes, after sending Cao Ping’s sister away, my mother-in-law hasn't nagged anymore."

"Your husband is really good to you," Yin Lifang said enviously. She admired her younger sister; although she wasn't very clever, their parents and elder sister doted on her, and after marriage, her husband was highly positioned and remained devoted.

Yin Liyi, not wanting to upset her sister, only said, "Every family has its own problems. By the way, sister, how is Huo Ping treating you? Does she dare to boss you around?"

"It's just for show," Yin Lifang said indifferently. Besides, Princess Wei didn't dare to go too far. Although she was once the official princess, and Yin Lifang was only a secondary consort, she was now the mother of the Prince of Yuzhang, and her brother-in-law was in power.

Moreover, in another year, Jianjia would marry Wei Duo's son, Wei Xiao. After their alliance with the Wei family, their influence would grow.

Yin Liyi, concerned for her sister, told her another piece of news. "I heard that the Crown Princess's consort, Wei Liangdi, gave birth to a son and might be named Crown Princess. The Zheng Liangdi who was by the Crown Prince's side has no chance now."

With Zheng Liangdi out of the picture, it meant that the Zheng family's backing had collapsed.

Yin Lifang smiled. "This is good news." With the Zheng family failing, Li Cheng, who thought he could dominate the world with the Zheng family's support, would now be caught between enemies.

As for the Eastern Palace, ever since Wei Liangdi gave birth to a son, fewer people were now flattering De Yin. When De Yin was in charge of the Eastern Palace and was favored, people would automatically send her favorite foods and items without her needing to say anything. But now, it was completely different.

The standard meals from the main kitchen were placed on the table. Knowing that she didn't like fish, they still sent many fish dishes.

Yunzhi wanted to say something but didn't dare to complain, remembering what happened to Lianzhi. The masters would be fine, but the servants would likely suffer.

Moreover, a few days ago, while she was serving him, the Crown Prince had remarked that she smelled nice, his words carrying a hint of ambiguity. Yunzhi's heart raced.

Noticing the servant was silent, De Yin said, "The Crown Prince often comes to see me, but I have not conceived. It seems I’m not destined to have children. Yunzhi, I have an idea. What do you think?"

"What idea?" Yunzhi asked.

De Yin smiled and said, "When I entered the palace, four palace maids followed me. You and Lianzhi were my personal attendants. The other two were given to me by my grandmother to help secure my position. Especially Pan'er, she has grown into a beautiful young woman. I plan to have her serve the Crown Prince the next time he comes."

Yunzhi’s heart sank, but she forced a smile and said, "Pan'er is indeed beautiful, but she has a frivolous nature. I fear she might anger the Crown Prince."

"No, she has become much more well-behaved since entering the palace," De Yin replied. Pan'er was born into servitude, and her family’s indenture papers are in De Yin’s possession. It was because she was not clever that De Yin found her easy to control.

Yunzhi secretly glanced at De Yin. She needed to plan her own future as well. Lianzhi had died a tragic death, and De Yin could no longer protect her people. Despite Yunzhi's dedicated service, De Yin was only promoting Pan'er. Would she, Yunzhi, have to bow to Pan'er, someone who had always been beneath her?

Why should I accept that?

Huiyin didn’t want to dwell on it and casually brought up, "I heard that the General of the Established Might and Governor of Yuzhou, Guo Zhao, has lost his wife."

"Yes, his wife left him with a young son, a clever boy of seven or eight years old," Li Cheng was quite familiar with the Guo family's situation.

Huiyin then said, "Jiang girl has moved from Jianye to Xuzhou recently. Although she has adopted a child, she still wishes to find a good husband. Guo Zhao comes from a humble background but has great abilities. He is currently in need of a wife, and Jiang girl was originally looking for an unmarried talented man. Guo Zhao's official position can compensate for his lack of unmarried status. What do you think?"

Li Cheng was very honest, "From our perspective, it would be better if she didn't marry, so she could rely only on us and be fully devoted. Marrying her to Guo Zhao might embolden him."

"In that case, forget it. I was just spur of the moment," Huiyin replied, still able to distinguish what was important.

Li Cheng, upon hearing this, said, "Well, if both Jiang and Guo agree, I, as their lord, will gladly give my approval. As they say, one should help others find happiness."

"Don't force it if it feels wrong. What you said does make some sense," Huiyin responded.

With Li Cheng's approval, the couple decided to act separately. Huiyin first called Jiang Bipbo and spoke directly, "For someone of lesser standing, I wouldn’t consider them a worthy match for you. General Guo, now Governor of Yuzhou, is thirty-three years old and has a son who is seven or eight years old. I plan to bring the boy into the mansion to study with the heir. If you marry him, you will be the Governor's wife, and your clansmen will not dare to bully you. I usually don't like playing matchmaker, as it can cause resentment, but seeing that Guo Zhao is willing to remarry and this is indeed a good match, I feel compelled to arrange it."

If it were Yuwendang who had lost his wife, it would be a different matter. Yuwendang, coming from a noble family, had very high standards even for a remarriage.

Of course, if Jiang Bipbo disagreed, Huiyin would choose another suitable lady for Guo Zhao. This was something the wife of a lord should do. Managing the household affairs of the generals would allow them to focus on their duties without worries.

Jiang Bipbo had actually met Guo Zhao before. When her clansmen caused trouble, Li Cheng had dealt with it together with Guo Zhao. He was indeed a strong and capable man. Although he didn't have Yuwendang's good looks, he gave a sense of security. Moreover, Guo Zhao held a high official position. A truly talented young man might not have such a high position and might not be able to protect her.

Jiang Bipbo made her decision quickly and without hesitation, "I will leave it to the Princess to decide."

Seeing Jiang Bipbo agree so readily, Li Cheng was a bit uncertain, "I heard Jiang girl is very picky. Why did she agree to remarry so quickly?"

"That's because I plan to have Guo Zhao's son join our mansion. Firstly, it will save her from dealing with a stepson. Secondly, in a more strategic sense, we will have a hostage. Moreover, when it comes to remarriage, it depends on who it is. He is the Governor of Yuzhou and the General of the Established Might, and your trusted confidant. Just as men admire strength, women do too," Huiyin explained.

Additionally, she added, "If Jiang girl truly didn't want to marry, that would be another matter. But she does want to marry and hopes to find a good family. If we keep ignoring her needs, as the saying goes, an older unmarried woman can become a source of resentment if not properly settled. If she were to be lured away by someone else under such conditions, it would be worse. Moreover, I heard that Jiang girl and Cao Ping’s sister were close friends. If Cao Ping’s sister were to marry someone inferior to Jiang Bipbo, even if the Cao family doesn’t rebel, it would be difficult for them."

Li Cheng nodded in agreement, clearly impressed. "With Huiyin by my side, I am truly like a tiger with wings."

"Let's wait and see," Huiyin smiled.

title: Chapter 62
content:
Chapter 62

◎Combined Double Chapters◎

After receiving Jiang Bipbo's consent, Li Cheng wrote to Guo Zhao, who also agreed.

Guo Zhao agreed quickly. Although Jiang Bipbo was a merchant's daughter, she was no ordinary one. As the head of a prominent salt merchant family, she was young and beautiful, with the backing of the Prince of Huaiyin and as the foster sister of the princess.

Although Huiyin had never organized a wedding before, she had been married herself and even intended to raise the grandeur of this wedding. Therefore, she persuaded Jiang Bipbo, "This is your first marriage. A person's wedding day is the most attention they will ever receive in their lifetime. Since you are my foster sister, it's perfectly fine to have a grand ceremony."

Jiang Bipbo smiled and said, "I leave everything in the princess’s hands."

Huiyin also had several boxes of dowry sent to Jiang Bipbo. Seeing that the boxes were painted with gold powder depicting dragons and phoenixes, it was clear that the contents inside were extremely valuable. Jiang Bipbo knelt down to express her gratitude, feeling immensely thankful.

As they left Huaiyin Mansion, Steward Lin remarked, "The princess is as good as her word. She’s found you an excellent match. Once you marry into Yuzhou, you’ll be the prefect’s wife, and the elders in your family have already been visiting more often."

"I moved my family's business to Xuzhou, originally intending to rely on the Prince of Huaiyin, but relying on others always felt unreliable. Look at what happened to Lady Cao when Prince Wei passed away; she was rejected. Now, the princess has told me that Guo Zhao is a capable man, so my future is secured. No one will dare to challenge me when managing the business." Jiang Bipbo was very satisfied.

Steward Lin smiled and said, "Now, it seems your luck has finally turned for the better. Since the princess wants to hold a grand ceremony, we should invite everyone extensively."

Jiang Bipbo said, "We should definitely invite Lady Cao. She’s been through so much with the Xie family, and it might do her some good to get out and enjoy herself."

"I'm afraid she might not come," Steward Lin thought. Lady Cao had suffered such humiliation that she might not want to attend.

Jiang Bipbo didn't explain but just smiled, "If she refuses to come, just send the invitation to her family. Our families have business dealings, and if I don't send an invitation, people might think I'm looking down on them."

Steward Lin thought about it and agreed.

Both women had once been spinsters. Jiang Bipbo had initially hoped to become Li Cheng’s concubine but failed. Now, as the princess’s foster sister and soon-to-be wife of the prefect, this marriage could help her settle old scores. Steward Lin realized that Jiang Bipbo might be using this opportunity to assert herself, especially since Lady Cao had once sent her an invitation when she married into the Xie family, only to be rejected and face criticism now.

When the Jiang family's wedding invitation arrived at Lady Cao's family, Lady Cao and her daughter were taking a walk in the garden. Although Lady Cao came from a merchant family, she had been cultivated by her family and was proficient in music, chess, calligraphy, and painting. Seeing the fallen flowers, she felt a kinship with them.

Lady Cao saw someone delivering a wedding invitation and immediately told her maid, "Take it away."

"Mother, what is it?" Lady Cao's daughter asked.

Lady Cao didn't want her daughter to know and lied, "It's nothing, just an ordinary invitation."

Lady Cao's daughter was very intelligent and guessed immediately, "How many wedding invitations have you hidden from me these days, Mother? The more you do this, the more it seems like I care."

In fact, Lady Cao already knew that Xie Jiuyi had used benefits to silence her father and brothers. Sacrificing her was nothing. Yin Ping’s appearance and talents were actually inferior to hers, but General Xie loved her. This was something she couldn’t achieve no matter what tricks she tried.

Lady Cao's mother saw her daughter's reaction and had to tell the truth, "It’s Miss Jiang’s wedding invitation."

"Her? Is she getting married too? I thought she had adopted a child." Lady Cao reacted strongly.

Both were ambitious young women from merchant families. Knowing that Jiang Bipbo had been rejected by Li Cheng, she had felt a sense of relief, but now, seeing Jiang Bipbo getting married, she felt a pang of envy.

"Who is it? Is he adopting her?"

Lady Cao's mother shook her head, "It's the newly appointed prefect of Yuzhou, Guo Zhao, the General of Jianwei." Seeing her daughter's complexion darken, she quickly added, "It’s a secondary wife, meaning she’ll be raising someone else’s children."

Lady Cao's hand holding the handkerchief turned white.

"Would you like some fruit puree?" Huiyin cut up fresh fruit and handed it to Zhan'er, but he shook his head.

**

The wet nurse of Zhan'er said, "Second Master came here after eating some fruit."

So that's how it is, Huiyin smiled. "Then I'll spend some time playing with him. These days, I've been preoccupied with other matters and have neglected my little one."

This is how it is after marriage; one always has to think about the family, husband, and children, but there's less time for oneself. Actually, she was much more relaxed compared to ordinary people. Li Cheng only had her as his wife and had no concubines. She had also successfully given birth to two sons. Her in-laws had passed away, and even her great-grandmother-in-law had to avoid clashing with her. But still, it wasn't as leisurely as when she was in her maiden days.

But then she thought, when she was in her maiden days, there were many things she couldn't decide for herself. Now, she could make decisions for everything and didn't have to be on edge like in her previous life.

Playing with children usually involves playing with toys, telling stories, or taking them out to play. Only by accompanying the child would they feel secure.

"Mother, I want to play with the big grasshopper," Zhan'er said, handing a grass-woven insect to Huiyin.

Huiyin held the grass, and when Zhan'er tried to grab it, she lifted it up. Zhan'er loved this game and jumped up to grab it. Huiyin played along with him until Li Cheng returned.

When Li Cheng came back, he lifted his son high, which was always the children's favorite part.

Zhan'er was cheering now, calling "Father" with every word.

Huiyin tried to talk to him, but he couldn't hear her anymore.

Fortunately, after such energetic play, the child got tired and started fussing to go out. Huiyin let the wet nurse take him out to play while she got up to wring a cloth and handed it to Li Cheng.

Li Cheng took the cloth, wiped the sweat from his forehead, and sat down. "The weather is getting hotter. This year's weather is unusual. The other day, I mentioned that even if I went out by myself, I was drenched in sweat."

"Isn't that so? The weather is always stuffy, and the body feels sticky. Now, the plum rain season is coming again. I'm preparing to rest for a month," Huiyin felt that sleeping during rainy days was the best.

Hearing about the plum rain season, Li Cheng felt a pang of emotion. "Don't you think the plum rain season makes it easy to dream, making everything feel unreal, like a series of dreams?"

Actually, the couple had a somewhat childlike innocence. They didn't discuss governmental matters together every day. Sometimes, Li Cheng would say some very childish words, and only Huiyin would discuss them with him.

But about what he said, Huiyin felt quite emotional. "I wonder if it's like Zhuang Zhou dreaming of being a butterfly, where reality and illusion blur. Husband, do you think people could have another life? What if you had married someone else?"

"If I didn't marry you, who would I marry? I can't even imagine not being your husband," Li Cheng always felt this statement was strange and that he shouldn't have brought up such a topic.

Seeing her husband like this, Huiyin thought that in her previous life, she wasn't actually his wife, but she couldn't say that out loud. She touched his cheek. "If there's a war in the future, don't act rashly or let your guard down. Your survival is our hope."

Li Cheng rarely saw Huiyin like this. His wife was usually very open-minded. Even in the most difficult times, she remained optimistic. But at this moment, her sparkling eyes were filled with sadness, and his heart ached. He cupped his wife's face and asked, "What's wrong?"

In that moment, their love for each other deepened, and they thought more of each other than themselves.

Huiyin leaned on his broad shoulders, feeling very reassured.

But before she could react, it became too mushy. Just then, it was announced that Lady Mu had come over. Huiyin tidied her clothes before going out. Lady Mu coming at this time meant she had something on her mind; otherwise, she would have sent a visiting card in advance.

"Your Highness, I have come to ask for your help," Lady Mu said, crying as she spoke.

Huiyin looked at her. "Speak slowly. Over the years, you've always been respectful to me. If you have any difficulties, feel free to tell me."

Lady Mu then stopped crying. "It's not about me. It's about your maid, Dong Shun."

Dong Shun? Ever since she returned from the temple, Dong Shun had been restless. Huiyin noticed she was no longer young. Just then, Lady Mu was there, and upon hearing that her maid was getting married, she helped arrange a match. It was with a scholar from her son-in-law's family. He was from a poor background but was talented and wanted to marry a capable wife who could manage household affairs. As they say, it's better to marry a well-bred servant than a poorly raised daughter. Dong Shun was quite beautiful and in the prime of her life, and Huiyin had prepared a nice dowry for her.

But she had been busy with the Jiang and Guo families' matters and hadn't had time to follow up.

Now, hearing what Lady Mu said, Huiyin's heart tightened. "Is she dead?"

"No, no. She's pregnant but was bitten by a dog and miscarried." Lady Mu had heard that Huiyin was particularly good to her maids. While this maid was insignificant, she didn't want to cause any hard feelings with the princess.

Huiyin felt relieved. Except for life and death, everything else was minor. She asked for the details, and although Lady Mu was hesitant, she mentioned it was due to her sister-in-law. The dog raised by her sister-in-law had accidentally bitten Dong Shun.

A restless household can easily lead to chaos. Fugui, ask Physician Hu to go and check on Dong Shun. Use whatever medicine is necessary and see if there's anything else she needs help with. Huiyin could only do so much.

……

After a while, Fugui went to see Huiyin. By this time, it was late in the evening. Huiyin looked at her and said, "You’ve worked hard today. Take tomorrow off and don’t worry about coming in."

"Don't worry about me, my lady. Today, when Dong Shun learned that you were concerned about her, she was moved to tears and very grateful," Fugui spoke on Dong Shun's behalf while sitting on the footstool.

"You’re making too much of it. There’s no need to be so grateful," Huiyin didn't think it was a big deal.

However, Fugui smiled and said, "She’s already married, yet you still sent someone to check on her health. To be honest, even her own family wouldn’t have done so much for her." Seeing that Fugui seemed reluctant to mention Dong Shun's family issues, she only added, "Dong Shun regrets it and has been saying that she still wants to come back to serve you."

"She needs to be strong. This is not a safe haven. Since she's married, she should focus on building her own life. By the way, was it a rabid dog that bit her?" People always romanticize paths not taken. Dong Shun had previously complained that serving in the mansion was exhausting and that even if she stayed, she might not have been happy. It's better to focus on the path she's currently on.

Fugui shook her head. "No, it was just an ordinary dog. You know Dong Shun loves eating ham. Since she was pregnant, she made a bone broth with ham. It smelled so good that it attracted the dog. But I don't think it was an accident."

"A lesson learned is a lesson earned. She should focus on her health, build her life, and learn from this experience," Huiyin said, having helped her stand up to her in-laws this time, but she couldn't do it every time. Even when her own daughter gets married, she couldn't be so meticulous, let alone for Dong Shun.

Fugui said, "Yes, I've been advising her the same."

Li Cheng was also aware of Dong Shun's situation. He said to Huiyin, "I told you to just marry her off within the household. You indulged her wishes, and now she wants to come back to serve. How can that be?"

"Even if she had stayed in the mansion, she would have eventually been married off, and who knows if she would have been any happier. There's no Shangri-la in life," Huiyin replied.

For a moment, Li Cheng was reminded that his wife had also married into a distant family and probably had a hard time back then.

Since Fugui had duties and couldn't visit Dong Shun, it was Le Yun who went. She brought tonics with her and, upon seeing Dong Shun lying in bed, said, "My husband told me that the dog wasn't rabid. You've had a miscarriage, but it didn't damage your foundation. Rest well, and you'll recover."

Even with Le Yun's comfort, Dong Shun wasn't happy. Her husband was a scholar who loved to save face and pretended to be noble. He wasn't a bad person, but even though they were attached to the mansion, the subtle sense that he looked down on her as a former servant was something she could feel, even if it was never spoken.

She told Le Yun that she wanted to go back. After being frightened by a ghost, she always felt that there were too many troubles in the mansion. As a servant, even when scared, she couldn't cry freely. From that day on, she longed for freedom. The princess consort quickly agreed and didn't make things difficult, even bestowing a dowry. She married a scholar, but after the marriage, she felt it was far worse than the mansion.

This family was a distant branch of a wealthy clan. They only ate two meals a day, had an egg once every ten days, and meat once a month. Her sister-in-law, the daughter of a scholar, wore patched clothes and was quite frugal in her ways. This was why Fugui and Qiu Feng didn't want to leave.

She confided her sorrows to Le Yun, who could only advise her to live her life well. The princess consort had given her twelve trunks of dowry, one hundred taels of silver for the bottom of the chest, and some private savings Huiyin had accumulated over the years. The gifts from the sisters were also quite substantial. Even Le Yun's dowry for Dong Shun included two bolts of silk, two gold hairpins, two gold combs, a box of tonics, not to mention what Fugui and Qiu Feng gave. With all this money, Dong Shun should have lived well, but she just wanted to go back to serving.

However, compared to Dong Shun's regret of marrying out of the mansion, Yunzhi was determined to climb up to the Crown Prince. When Li Heng came to De Yin's place, she deliberately adorned a flower in her hair.

But she still held a tray in her hands and said, "Liangdi, I just asked Pan'er to serve, but she couldn't even deliver tea properly and spilled the cup. Luckily, I saw it in advance."

De Yin, seeing that the Crown Prince had already entered the inner room, signaled her to be quiet. "Just take the tea over."

In De Yin's mind, she had never thought of giving Yunzhi to Li Heng as a concubine. Firstly, Yunzhi was her trusted confidante and very capable. Secondly, Yunzhi's appearance was not suitable to be a concubine.

But she didn't expect that after Li Heng and De Yin were intimate, he would still entangle with Yunzhi. Seeing that Li Heng was interested in her, Yunzhi became even more delighted. She often eavesdropped, mostly to know when to deliver water, but because of this, she had a general idea of Li Heng's preferences in bed. As a servant, she was more open-minded.

At first, Li Heng was just playing along, wanting to use De Yin's people for his own purposes and to stabilize the Zheng family. But after a few times, he found the girl had her merits, and the secretive nature of their affair was quite stimulating.

Yunzhi couldn't wait for De Yin to discover them. At least then it would be legitimate, but unfortunately, De Yin never found out. When Yunzhi realized she was pregnant, she pleaded with Li Heng, "Your Highness, it's my honor to serve you. Now that I'm pregnant, I know my status is low, and I dare not carry the royal heir. Please send me out of the palace. If Liangdi finds out, I have no face to see her again."

This strategy of retreating to advance worked, and Li Heng immediately said, "Since you're carrying my child, do you think you can leave? I'll just inform your mistress."

For Li Heng, unifying the world was a daunting task, but he wasn’t hesitant to take in a servant. After all, children born to these low-status servants posed little threat.

Yunzhi got what she wanted and became one of the Crown Prince’s women, although she was only given the title of Chenghui and shared a residence with another Baolin. But she didn't mind.

This incident was a huge blow to De Yin. Though Yunzhi claimed she needed to rest during her pregnancy and avoided seeing De Yin, she couldn’t help but speak honestly when her former mistress came to visit. "Liangdi, this isn't a betrayal of you. After all, aren’t we both just servants who are pregnant?"

"If you really wanted to, why didn’t you tell me earlier? Instead, you conspired to deceive me." De Yin truly felt deeply betrayed.

"But, Liangdi, you are a noble lady. No matter what mistake you make, the Crown Prince won’t do anything to you. However, for us servants, we can be beaten or scolded at will. When Lianzhi died, even you were unable to do anything. I’m only fighting for my own life. We servants were not born to be servants. Even though we have lowly lives, we still want to live properly."

These words sounded harsh to De Yin’s ears. She believed they were only after wealth and status, willing to betray their mistress to become concubines, hoping to secure a better future by bearing children. She couldn’t understand why Yunzhi had distanced herself because of this, especially since she had also been deeply saddened by Lianzhi’s death.

Seeing De Yin in a daze, Yunzhi said reluctantly, "Liangdi, don’t worry. After I give birth to the child, I will bring them to you in the future."

"I don’t want the sympathy of a servant." De Yin walked out with her back straight.

---

As for the matters of the servants, Huiyin didn’t take it too much to heart. In previous years, the Mid-Autumn and New Year gifts from the Zheng family had been extremely generous. This year, however, the gifts were not as abundant and didn’t seem as fresh.

It was probably due to the severe drought in Jizhou last year, Huiyin thought.

The most pressing matter was Jiang Bipbo’s wedding. They hoped it would pressure the Cao family. Guo Zhao needed to remarry soon, and Jiang Bipbo was no longer young. While the wedding ceremonies were simplified, the betrothal gifts and dowry were still given in great abundance.

Jiang Bipbo’s parents had passed away, so Huiyin brought her into the mansion the day before the wedding, preparing for her to marry from the mansion. She even set aside a delicate courtyard for her.

"Tomorrow morning, you will prepare for the wedding ceremonies. I’ve already spoken to the Prince. A team of soldiers will escort you to Yuzhou. By now, our forces have cleared out most of the bandits and robbers in this area. You can rest assured," Huiyin said, holding her hand.

Jiang Bipbo looked at the new wedding dress hanging on the rack, the hem woven with golden threads into a phoenix. It was as if her life could be reborn from the ashes like the mythical bird. She shifted her gaze and thanked the person in front of her, "Madam, you have taken me in as a sworn sister and shown me such care. I don’t know how I can repay you in the future."

Huiyin waved her hand, "I’m afraid you’ll blame me for arranging your marriage if you don’t live well in the future. You’re a smart person and know how to make a good life. Treat the past as clouds and focus on your future."

She didn’t like to say too many empty words, especially to those in difficult situations. If she could help, she would. If she couldn’t, she would step aside. Asking for repayment after helping someone was not something she valued.

However, Jiang Bipbo took out two contract-like documents from her sleeve and handed them to Huiyin, "My family owns eleven salt estates and eight large grain estates. Some shops and houses were given to my adopted brother, but the rest are in my hands. Without saying too much, I offer you two salt estates and one grain estate as private savings."

"I cannot accept this." Huiyin quickly refused.

Jiang Bipbo smiled, "If you don’t accept, you really don’t see me as a sister. If it weren’t for you, not only would I have been forcibly taken as a concubine by the Huo family, but I might have also lost the family wealth. I know you don’t need the money, but I have nothing else to offer. Please accept these, and in the future, they can be for the two young princes. As merchants, we often say that money is like a silent partner—having it brings peace of mind."

Seeing her sincerity, Huiyin accepted. Jiang Bipbo was clearly pleased. Huiyin then briefed her on Guo Zhao’s situation and instructed her to develop agriculture and commerce in Yuzhou after she moved there. Finally, she handed her an exquisite book of fire-avoidance paintings and hurried out of the bridal chamber, almost as if she were fleeing.

To her surprise, Li Cheng was waiting outside. She quickly ran over. "I thought you had guests?"

Li Cheng smiled, "I do have guests, the Cao family. This time, they are much more sincere and have even told me Xie Jiuyi’s grain storage locations."

"Is that so? That’s wonderful." Huiyin hadn’t expected the Cao family to turn so quickly.

title: Chapter 63
content:
Chapter 63

◎Are they serious?◎

After the death of the Prince of Wei, the young Prince of Yuzhang inherited a vast and prosperous territory. To the surrounding lords, it was as if a child were walking through a bustling market with a golden ingot in hand. Many expected that after the Prince of Wei's death, Li Cheng would create chaos, allowing them to gradually seize his territory. Now, seeing that Li Cheng had no intention of stirring up chaos, some couldn't help but make their moves.

Especially Zhao Hong, who had previously attempted to annex Jingzhou. But things didn't go as planned, so he regrouped and began to seize Nanjun. At that time, Xie Jiuyi, who was based in Jianye, dispatched General Huang Kuan to launch an attack. Huang Kuan was a veteran of Wei and had been fighting alongside the Prince of Wei since the prince's enfeoffment.

"We can hold out for a while longer," Li Cheng told Huiyin.

Huiyin smiled. "Don't worry about them. The Cao family is hedging their bets, so don’t let your guard down."

Li Cheng nodded. "I have my own judgments."

"Although Xie Jiuyi is managing the affairs of the Prince of Yuzhang, his position is not legitimate. Therefore, he has to stay in Jianye and cannot move around freely. If he leaves, something might happen to the Prince of Yuzhang," Huiyin analyzed.

Li Cheng was aware of this. He asked Huiyin, "How are Ling Lu and Ling Jiu serving you?"

Huiyin thought for a moment. "They are doing very well. Although they haven't been serving me since childhood, they have adapted well to my habits now."

"Hmm, don't give out their sale contracts casually in the future. These people serving closely to us know too much about our family. If this information falls into the wrong hands, it won't be good," Li Cheng said.

Huiyin understood. "Alright, I've been focusing too much on their freedom. In the future, I’ll choose reliable servants from among our household slaves. Those hired temporarily shouldn't serve closely."

This was a critical moment. As a mistress, after Li Cheng's reminder, she realized her approach had issues.

Li Cheng appreciated Huiyin's rationality and her willingness to correct her mistakes, rather than pretending she was right or paying lip service while secretly going against her words.

Why was Huiyin so good—not in the sense of being a people-pleaser, but in her ability to communicate effectively and truly understand others?

"I want to send the New Year gifts to Jizhou earlier. Sigh, I wonder how Jizhou is doing now?" Huiyin sighed, it was her natal family after all, and she couldn't neglect her father and brother.

After saying that, she glanced at Li Cheng. Seeing that he didn't say anything, she knew in her heart that during the previous incident in Qingzhou, her father might have wanted to seize her husband's territory. Li Cheng wasn't foolish either. Although he had resolved the matter quietly for her sake, it didn't mean he didn't have his own calculations.

He treated her well because she was his wife, but her natal family wasn’t his concern.

Just like how Huiyin never considered Grand Dowager Wu as part of Li Cheng's family. She only regarded Li Cheng and their children as her family. With this empathy, she couldn't ask Li Cheng to abandon his principles and stance for her sake.

Li Cheng stood up and finally said, "The situation in Jizhou is beyond our reach for now. We can only focus on the present."

As for Jiang Bipbo, a month after she married into Yuzhou, she wrote to Huiyin, saying that Guo Zhao had entrusted the management of the household to her and that they treated each other with mutual respect. She also sent local products of Yuzhou to Huiyin, who was very satisfied and shared some with Guo Zhao's son.

Nanny Nan was also pleased. "Jiang girl has achieved her desire. This marriage was well done by you, and I'm also happy for her. Since she is your sworn sister, you've gained another relative."

Huiyin raised her hand to stop her. "You can't completely trust the Jiang family. Right now, she’s close to me because I think of her when good things happen, but that might not be the case in the future." She couldn’t delve too deeply into this. In fact, Jiang Bipbo marrying Guo Zhao was better than a daughter from a powerful family marrying him.

But if Guo Zhao's name was brought up, it might not be good if someone overheard.

"You always think further ahead than I do, but overthinking can lead to headaches. I think you should rest more when you're free," Nanny Nan genuinely cared about Huiyin.

Huiyin smiled. "Don't worry, I understand."

After saying that, she wondered how the Cao family's daughter would react seeing Jiang Bipbo marrying so well. What would Xie Jiuyi and Yin Liyi, the couple, think?

Actually, Xie Jiuyi and Yin Liyi hadn't thought about this at all. Although Xie Jiuyi had replaced many of his trusted aides in Wei with his own people, he still couldn't fully control the situation. Families like the Guo and Huo families didn't necessarily listen to him, and even the Prince of Yuzhang, being young, was easily deceived.

Now with Zhao Hong's arrival, Xie Jiuyi feared the old general again and couldn't leave. He was somewhat exhausted.

Yin Liyi brought her daughter to visit her sister and mentioned that her sister treated Fangjie very well. The child was originally named Zhenfang, inspired by Yin Liyi’s own name.

"Sister, let your daughter stay with me for a few days this time so that you can take care of the younger ones at home," Yin Lifen said.

Yin Liyi smiled and replied, "If you like her, I couldn’t be more grateful. It’s just that my daughter has a bit of an unusual personality, and I’m afraid she might disturb you."

Yin Lifen shook her head. "What are you saying? I find your daughter to be very sensible. To be honest, Jing’er and I owe our current positions to your support and your husband’s help. I see that Jing’er gets along well with your daughter, so why not strengthen our bond through marriage?"

Strengthen the bond through marriage? Yin Liyi readily agreed. Li Jing had a compassionate and gentle nature, while her daughter was always domineering. They would actually make a good match.

Moreover, the Prince of Yuzhang was royalty, after all. If he were to rise to power, their daughter’s status would rise with him. Of course, she didn’t dwell too much on these matters, as it was still too early to talk about them. However, since she had always had a good relationship with her sister, she was also willing to strengthen their bond through marriage.

The two sisters chatted for a while, and when the topic turned to Yin Lijun’s marriage, Yin Liyi said, "Mother has been looking into potential families lately, but we don’t know which family to choose."

Now that the Yin family’s status had risen significantly, their previous prospects were long left behind. Who wouldn’t want to secure a good match for their daughter?

However, Yin Lifen had other plans. "Don’t worry, in a few days, all the noble ladies here will come to pay their respects to me. If I find a good match, I’ll recommend her to you."

"What you say makes sense, even my husband agrees. Our nephew is still young, and we can’t rely solely on the Xie family," Yin Liyi said, feeling a pang of sympathy for her husband.

Yin Lifen, who was once a cifei, had hidden her abilities from others. Now, as Empress Dowager Yin Cifei, she no longer needed to hide her actions. She decided to find an extremely prestigious match for Yin Lijun, and within three days, she had made her choice.

The match she selected for Yin Lijun was the second son of General Gao Ningzhi, Gao Hua. While Gao Hua wasn’t the eldest son, his mother was Gao Ningzhi’s legitimate wife, and his maternal family was a prominent clan in Jianye. His uncle was currently taking over Li Cheng’s naval command in Poyang.

The Yin family also met Gao Hua, and seeing his proper appearance and prestigious background, they were very satisfied.

The betrothal gifts from the Gao family arrived promptly, causing a traffic jam in the entire street. At that moment, Cao Shi happened to witness it. She was still unmarried, and although her family had the means to marry her off, being a woman who had been returned to her family meant she could only marry into a lower-status merchant family.

The passersby were discussing, "This marriage is between the younger sister of Empress Dowager Yin Cifei and the son of General Gao. No wonder it’s such a grand affair."

Cao Shi looked even more displeased and said to Lady Cao, "The Xie family promised to compensate us, but is this how they compensate? My family has contributed more than the Jiang family and is wealthier, yet we are treated like this."

Even Lady Cao was angered. Although they were merchants, Xie Jiuyi had entrusted the business of the entire Nanjun to the Cao family, but these were benefits they rightfully deserved. When the Cao family helped Xie Jiuyi attack Nanjun, the Prince of Wei had already agreed to these terms.

However, to be humiliated by Xie Jiuyi like this, would the Cao family continue to receive these benefits? Such sudden changes in policy were truly unbelievable.

"His aunt’s daughter can marry into the Gao family. But what is the Yin family? They were never a high-ranking family to begin with. Yin Cifei was just the daughter of a clerk in the Prince of Wu’s mansion. They weren’t even considered a poor family. It was just luck that she bore a son, and now they act all high and mighty. It’s only because the Prince of Huaiyin is benevolent and righteous, unwilling to bully them as widows and orphans," Lady Cao ranted indiscreetly.

Cao Shi hurriedly tried to stop her, "Mother, please say less. What if someone hears?"

Lady Cao patted her daughter’s hand, "At this point, what is there to fear? That Yin Liyi, what is she? A woman who has traveled extensively and was once captured by rebels in Yuzhou. Who knows if her virtue is still intact?"

"Mother, you’re letting your anger cloud your judgment," Cao Shi advised, though she didn’t entirely disagree in her heart.

Neither Yin Liyi nor Xie Jiuyi had anticipated that the Cao family, which had been hedging its bets, would fully align with Li Cheng because of Yin Lijun’s marriage.

As Li Cheng had said, major events in the world often fall apart due to minor issues.

……

Huiyin was doing embroidery, which she hadn’t done in a long time and felt rusty. Today, she was embroidering a pine-green pouch with black ink thread, and she adjusted the design she had drawn. Just then, Li Cheng entered, and from the sound of his footsteps, she could tell he was in a good mood.

"Why are you so happy? Look, I was just about to make you a pouch. Do you like this design?" Huiyin held it up for him to see.

Li Cheng expressed his liking and laughed as he sat down to help her thread the needles, "You haven’t picked up embroidery in a long time, and you’re doing this just for me. Of course, I’m delighted. By the way, I have another piece of good news to share with you. The Cao family has agreed to sponsor two thousand stones of grain for me. The supplies have already arrived, and I plan to use this to seize Yanzhou as soon as possible."

Huiyin was surprised, "The Cao family? Are they serious?"

title: Chapter 64
content:
Chapter 64

◎Second Update◎

Yanzhou had always been the most favorable passage northbound, and Li Cheng had long set his sights on it. Being young, he was eager to try. Huiyin knew nothing about the wars outside, but she said, "I won’t say much, but since the Cao family has sent grain, you should properly organize your troops for the war. But don’t forget, I’ve hidden a thousand bushels of grain in Hongruo Temple in Xuzhou. If you find yourself in dire straits, just take it. Here, this is the jade token."

Li Cheng had heard her mention preparing a thousand bushels of grain before and thought she was just talking, but he didn’t expect her to actually do it. Although it might not be needed, it was a pleasant surprise. "Thank you," he said.

"Between a couple, there’s no need to be so polite. As for the grain sent by the Cao family, let me remind you again, check if there’s any poison in it. And if this battle lasts until winter, have you prepared winter coats for the soldiers?" Huiyin modified her drawing with a stroke and felt it looked much better.

Seeing that Huiyin didn’t take any credit and spoke casually, Li Cheng was actually quite curious. "I always feel you’re someone who doesn’t seek rewards for your kindness. Why are you so magnanimous?"

Huiyin smiled at his words and said, "I’m not a saint, how could I be magnanimous? It’s just that I don’t help those I don’t want to. If it’s too troublesome, I won’t bother. To put it this way, if Jiang Bipbo wasn’t related to you and came to ask me for help on her own, I probably wouldn’t have helped. I’m not the kind of saint you think I am. Honestly, the truth isn’t always pleasant."

In the end, she just felt that this was her way of being. She would never help others when she herself was in trouble. But if she did help, she didn’t expect anything in return, as high expectations often led to greater disappointment.

Li Cheng suddenly ran over and hugged Huiyin. "I promise I won’t let you down. If I ever fail you, feel free to hold me accountable."

"Why would I hit you with your thick skin? You’re only good-looking because of your face." Moved by her husband’s words, Huiyin couldn’t help but caress his handsome face.

But Li Cheng wanted to express his determination. Seeing Huiyin’s gentleness made him even happier, and he lifted her up and spun her around until Huiyin felt dizzy and tapped his arm for him to stop.

What has come over him? He used to be a valiant and formidable young general, but now he seems to have lost his composure.

Li Cheng had always been overly eager to execute his plans. After marriage, he had become more steady. He had long intended to take Yanzhou, and now with a strong army, he was itching to make a move.

Of course, Li Cheng still needed to make preparations, during which Huiyin couldn’t help much, so she simply rested more. As Nanny Nan said, it wasn’t good to worry too much.

Her life was quite leisurely, while Yin Liyi was anxious like an ant on a hot pan. She was confiding in Xie Jiuyi, "I didn’t expect the Cao family to pull the ladder after climbing up, so despicable."

"This person was probably bought by the Prince of Huaiyin a long time ago to deceive me and make their move. Now, because of this, we almost lost Nanjun, which was a sure thing. If I hadn’t had a backup plan, I would have really been tricked by the Cao family." Xie Jiuyi was also angry. He had given many military business deals to the Cao family, but they had gone so far, thinking he was a fool. Fortunately, he discovered it in time.

Yin Liyi sighed, "Now the Cao family has fled to Xuzhou, and there’s nothing we can do. I keep wondering if it’s because of the Cao family woman—"

Xie Jiuyi interrupted, "No, the Cao family wouldn’t betray us because of a woman. A woman means nothing to them."

With such an exchange of interests, it was clear that the Cao family wouldn’t be so angry over a woman, especially since Li Cheng hadn’t taken a Cao family woman as a side consort.

"I’m afraid it’s because the Cao family saw that the young Prince of Yuzhang was too young and decided to switch allegiances."

His reasoning made sense to Yin Liyi, and she also thought that if only Li Cheng hadn’t tried to stand on his own, by now, the Wei territory could have rivaled Wei Duo’s. But there were no "ifs."

After being convinced by her husband, one day, Yin Liyi accidentally overheard Lady Xie complaining, "Actually, what’s wrong with taking a concubine? I find Cao Ping’s sister to be gentle and considerate, not someone who seeks favor. Why can’t she be tolerated?"

"Madam, please don’t let the mistress hear this," the servants advised.

Lady Xie lowered her voice, probably still complaining about Yin Liyi, which hurt her deeply. She thought, "That Zheng Huiyin, who is still a consort, doesn’t allow the young prince to take concubines. Why isn’t anyone saying anything now?"

Unfortunately, she couldn’t show her feelings. If she wasn’t careful, people outside would say she was jealous. Even her younger cousin, Yin Lijun, was so virtuous. After marrying in, when her monthly period came, she offered her maid to her husband. Even her sister didn’t care about these things, as if only she found it problematic.

In fact, Huiyin encountered a similar issue because the Yanzhou governor wanted to offer his daughter to avoid war. The daughter of the Yanzhou governor was renowned in Xuzhou for her beauty and exceptional embroidery skills, even creating paintings with her needlework, and was called a goddess by the people of Yanzhou.

Nanny Nan and others were frightened when they heard this and advised, "That Lady Huo was once associated with the Prince of Wei. If the young prince doesn’t take her, it’s fine. But the daughter of the Yanzhou Duke, who is like a goddess, if the young prince falls for her, what will happen to you? There’s a saying, when the benefits are significant enough, people will be tempted."

The Yanzhou governor said that if Li Cheng took her as his primary wife, they would offer Yanzhou without a fight.

"Nanny Nan, the Yanzhou governor must know that the prince treats me well and is deliberately setting a trap." Huiyin thought for a moment and found it interesting.

Even Empress He wouldn’t dare promise to marry a daughter of the Zheng family in exchange for Ji Province. Such situations were likely a classic 'beauty trap,' where a beautiful woman was used to manipulate or deceive someone into making a poor decision. If he didn’t take the Yanzhou lady, when soldiers died in battle, they might think he valued beauty over power, which would be detrimental to his rule. But if he did take the lady, there would be another problem. Zheng Fang might attack from Qing Province, and the beauty trap in Yanzhou could succeed, allowing them to not only repel Li Cheng but even take Qing Province to the south.

But if the seduction plan of Song's daughter from Yanzhou fails, and Yanzhou continues to fight.

No matter the choice, Yanzhou remains in an unassailable position, which is why it still holds a place among the contending lords. They are truly not to be underestimated.

Nanny Nan asked, her voice trembling, "What if the Prince falls for the trap?"

"Then what he'll be waiting for is my retribution," Huiyin wouldn't let him off.

Even though she had been serving Huiyin for years, Nanny Nan still shivered. Just moments ago, the couple was affectionate, but now they could turn on each other in an instant.

Yuwendang, who was following Li Cheng, couldn't help but say, "In my humble opinion, my lord, even if you marry the Song's daughter and then attack Yanzhou, it wouldn't be a problem. If you marry the Song's daughter and Yanzhou truly surrenders, we get the land for free. But if Yanzhou doesn't surrender, we'll just fight as planned."

To him, adding another wife wouldn't be a big deal for his lord.

Li Cheng turned to look at him, "Nonsense, we're taking Yanzhou not for a woman. The people of Yanzhou broke their word and aided the enemies during the Qingzhou rebellion. There's no need to mention this anymore."

Now that he had finally become independent, being independent meant making his own decisions. Did Yanzhou think he was a three-year-old child?

Yuwendang had always been loyal to Li Cheng, and as they continued their march, Governor Song, growing increasingly desperate, said, "How come he's completely unmoved by what I said?"

Governor Song had only one daughter late in life, who was exceptionally beautiful and had a unique fragrance, so he cherished her as his most prized possession. The areas around Yanzhou, like Yuzhou, had all been taken by Li Cheng. Seeing Li Cheng's fierce advance, Governor Song prepared for battle on one hand and tried to set Wei Duo and Li Cheng at odds with each other by offering his daughter's hand in marriage on the other.

Of course, if Li Cheng were willing to marry his daughter as his primary wife, being a descendant of the Wu King, he might have a chance to become the ruler of the world in the future, and Song would become the father-in-law of the emperor.

Unexpectedly, Li Cheng wasn't falling for it and didn't mention the marriage alliance at all, only continuing his relentless campaign to seize cities and territories. He wouldn't slow down.

Seeing this, Governor Song immediately sent another envoy. Seeing that Li Cheng was young and handsome, the envoy couldn't help but say, "Young Prince, out of respect for your prestige, I wish to offer my daughter to you. If you become my son-in-law, I'll give you Yanzhou. What harm is there in that?"

"Song old man, stop babbling. I welcome your surrender, but your troops must lay down their arms and vacate the area. As for you, thinking that little Yanzhou could make me abandon my wife and children, you're really courting death." Li Cheng snorted coldly.

Seeing that this young man was unmoved by any attempts to sway him, Governor Song immediately sent his son to fight Yuwendang for a few rounds. Li Cheng's army was mostly very young soldiers who had just conquered Yuzhou a few months ago and were eager to take Yanzhou and gain Li Cheng's favor.

In Li Cheng's eyes, it didn't matter whether you were from a noble family or not; he only cared about your abilities. Just look at Guo Zhao, who came from a humble background but became the governor of Yuzhou and even married the wealthy Jiang family's daughter, essentially getting land and money.

This time, Governor Song lost again, but he still hadn't given up. He used a large sum of money to bribe a persuader to come again, bringing a portrait of his daughter, the Song's daughter. Li Cheng looked at it and pointed to himself, saying to everyone, "I, Li Cheng, don't even have a concubine. Why don't I understand? Everyone wants to send me beautiful women? Do I look like someone obsessed with lust?"

In his own perception, he was incredibly wise and heroic. If they were going to try to bribe his advisors and generals, that would show some skill, but all they did was send beautiful women. What kind of terrible reputation did he have that made everyone think this way?

Advisor Jian Tan accidentally discovered this quirk of Li Cheng's, that he could be overly argumentative. He usually didn't show it, but he could get very serious about certain things. Right now, he wished he could drag Old Man Song out to argue until he’s blue in the face. It was clear that his fighting spirit was through the roof.

Jian Tan hurriedly stepped forward to comfort him, "My good lord, Governor Song is just being vulgar himself and thinks you are also a vulgar person. Please, my lord, don't bother with him."

"What you say makes sense, we'll continue advancing tomorrow," Li Cheng slammed the table, completely unwilling to waste any more time with Governor Song.

Huiyin's daughter: Our Lord has embarrassed himself in front of everyone.

title: Chapter 65
content:
Chapter 65

◎First Update◎

In Li Cheng's view, Yanzhou was a barrier. If this barrier remained, he would not be able to expand. However, if he fully captured it, he would be directly facing various warlords. It would no longer be the time when the Wei King was around, when he was just sent out to fight, which didn’t directly concern him.

Yet, he had to proceed. To him, the Prince of Yuzhang was too young, and although Xie Jiuyi had the capability, he lacked the prestige to lead the overall situation. His abilities were there, but not strong enough to be exceptional. This could easily lead to problems.

It was like when the emperor was sick and unable to attend to affairs, causing unrest below. Who would listen to whom? Everyone saw the torn opening, and they all rushed to spill blood, vying for position. He and his wife often talked, and although she frequently showed anxiety in front of him, she rarely displayed weakness in front of the servants. If the master was at a loss, the servants' minds would become restless.

Huiyin received Li Cheng's letter in late autumn. The large tree in front of the courtyard had its golden leaves piled up like a small tower, and the maids quickly cleaned them all up. After reading the letter, she seemed much more at ease.

This was not an era where reason prevailed; it was a time of survival of the fittest. If you were strong and had a mighty army, your voice would carry weight. Li Cheng did not disappoint her. Amidst the cold political calculations, there was a touch of warmth.

"Today we'll have 'Dialyssus,' and send a portion to the Guo family's young master," Huiyin arranged with a smile.

Nanny Nan immediately started assigning tasks. Seeing that the princess was in a good mood, she guessed it must be good news from the frontline and felt happy too.

Jing'er had grown a year older this year. He was tall but very naughty. During dinner, he was still playing with a grass-woven grasshopper. He only shrank his neck and started eating after Huiyin gave him a glare.

There was no choice. She would rather be disliked by her son than have him be unruly and unfocused.

In this world, people respected the powerful. Even if you had many flaws, as long as you were strong enough, people would follow you. Conversely, if you were a good person but lacked ability, people would look down on you.

Huiyin understood that this belief was deeply flawed, but she couldn’t really teach her child according to the sage books. A child taught that way would not fit in.

After the meal, Jing'er was alone in the small study writing his homework. Huiyin did not allow anyone to bring tea or water to disturb him, as this also cultivated his concentration.

Once he finished, her son brought the homework over. After Huiyin checked it, the mother and son went outside for a walk to digest the food.

At this time, no matter if he wanted to climb trees or run and jump, Huiyin would not stop him. Sometimes, when in the mood, she would even play shuttlecock. Jing'er sometimes missed his father, but it was rare. Most of the time, he was happy and content.

The next morning, Huiyin had a visitor. It was none other than Xue Huanhuan, whose husband had gone to Nanjun to participate in the war as a trusted aide of Xie Jiuyi but unfortunately passed away last month.

She was in mourning, a common taboo, but after her husband's death, she returned to her natal family. With her mother, Lady Xue, they came to visit, and Huiyin gave the Xue family some face.

"Please accept my condolences."

Huiyin could only say this. The pain of losing a husband was not something an outsider could truly empathize with.

Xue Huanhuan's eyes were slightly red. "Thank you, Princess, for your comfort. I was originally from the Wei region, and after my late husband's passing, I returned from Jianye. I also thank you for accepting me."

If the Huaiyin Mansion did not accept her, she would have had to stay in Jianye. Otherwise, since they were no longer under the same fiefdom, it wouldn’t be possible to come and go freely.

"Don't be like this. I was worried that you were still in mourning, but now that you've come over, just live a good life at home." Huiyin was just saying polite words.

The old lady of the Xue family was originally a princess and had a good relationship with Grand Dowager Wu, so they gave the Xue family some face.

Lady Xue knew her daughter was in mourning and it wasn’t appropriate to stay long in the Huaiyin Mansion. Seeing that Huiyin didn’t say much, she took her daughter out. Once Xue Huanhuan got on the carriage, she said, "Mother, the fighting on the frontline is fierce, but I saw the princess was quite calm."

She and Yin Liyi were very close, and Yin Liyi had actually been anxious.

However, Lady Xue said, "She might not be as calm as she appears, but if she panicked before anything even happened, how would the people in the fiefdom view her?"

"You're right. By the way, I heard the Cao family has moved here. Has the Cao sister been betrothed to anyone?" Xue Huanhuan, close to Yin Liyi, knew that Yin Liyi had been troubled by the Cao sister before, but fortunately, General Xie was wise.

Lady Xue shook her head. "I haven't heard about that."

After all, Lady Xue wouldn’t know about a merchant's daughter.

Xue Huanhuan became a widow at a young age. Lady Xue knew that she and her husband had a deep bond, but after a year of mourning, she would need to find another marriage for her daughter so that she could have support for the rest of her life.

However, she could not find another military man for her daughter's next marriage. Soldiers tend to die young, and if her son-in-law were to pass away, it would leave a large family of orphans and widows—what would become of them?

This time, the defeat in Nanjun—who knows how many lives were lost.

The Cao family thought the same. They remarked, "I've been saying that General Xie is incompetent. Look, now there's a problem. Fortunately, we've moved to Xuzhou, and the prince has also entrusted the business south of Jiahui Pass in Qingzhou to us. He hasn't mistreated us."

Madame Cao smiled and said, "Yes, during the Mid-Autumn Festival, I brought my daughter to pay respects to the princess. With our status, we wouldn't normally have the chance to see the princess, but she praised the Cao family for their righteous deeds and said that my daughter was a fortunate person. Her words almost brought me to tears."

"I think that the Prince of Huaiyin is young and formidable. If we manage to take Yanzhou, it will show that the lord we follow is the right one. Now that we've just joined his side, we shouldn't be too eager for success. Once the prince understands our intentions, our status will be similar to the Jiang family's," the head of the Cao family said.

Madame Cao, being a woman, couldn't involve herself in business matters, but her daughter's marriage was of utmost importance to her. Seeing the men full of ambition, she didn't want to dampen their spirits, so she waited until everyone dispersed before going to her daughter's room.

Currently, Miss Cao lived a leisurely life in her boudoir, but she felt a lingering anxiety in her heart, unsure if she would be married at her age.

When Madame Cao arrived, Miss Cao stood up and greeted her, "Mother."

Madame Cao smiled and said, "Are you working on embroidery again? There are so many people working on it; there's no need to put in so much effort."

"I have nothing else to do, and embroidery helps pass the time," Miss Cao replied, lowering her head.

Madame Cao said, "Don't lose hope. In a few days, I'll get some invitations, and we'll go out more. How will we know who's good or not if we don't socialize?"

Miss Cao understood that her mother was worried about her, so she complied. It's truly the case that a parent's heart is filled with concern for their child.

Similarly, Madame Ji felt the same way. Both Pei Shuo and Zheng Wuheng were her sons, and while her eldest son's talents and abilities were no less than her youngest's, everything had to prioritize the youngest. She understood the reasoning but still felt a little hurt. Therefore, whenever Xin Shi came with her grandson, she would give generously.

This time, when Jizhou suffered from a famine, she also let Xin Shi take some meat and grain. This was seen by Cui Shi, the wife of Zheng Wuheng, who felt a bit displeased.

Cui Shi spoke to Zheng Wuheng, "Currently, we don't have enough grain at home. Big brother and his wife have already moved out on their own. Big brother's wife is such a shrewd person; I heard she has a lot hidden in her cellar. Mother doesn't know the details and gave away so much."

"Don't say such things. Big brother is also my elder brother. Every time we go to battle, he works hard for me, taking on the hardships while I take the credit. He's also our mother's son, so giving him some grain is only right," Zheng Wuheng didn't think much of it.

In Jizhou, there weren't many capable people available. His father had been living off past achievements for years, and recently, there had been frequent bandit raids. He had to arrange for his elder brother to suppress them. How could they let minor issues damage their brotherly relationship?

Cui Shi and Zheng Wuheng, a young couple, had never argued before. Seeing Zheng Wuheng's reaction, Cui Shi had to stop, "I was just mentioning it."

"Even if you mention it casually, it's not right. You don't know the situation in Jizhou right now. With the poor harvests, the bandits are rampant and very difficult to deal with," Zheng Wuheng explained to Cui Shi.

Cui Shi quickly admitted her mistake, "I was wrong; I shouldn't have said that. Please don't be mad at me."

Seeing his wife sincerely apologize, how could Zheng Wuheng be angry? He helped her sit down and said, "It's good that you understand these things. My elder brother is also my mother's treasure."

But in Cui Shi's heart, Pei Shuo was just a stepson brought in by Madame Ji. How could he be compared to Zheng Wuheng?

For Zheng Fang to treat a stepson this way was already fortunate. How could he dare to compete with the real master? But she could never say these things; she could only think about them in her heart.

Similarly, Xin Shi was also dissatisfied. "It's already late autumn, and we're short on supplies. Those bandits and thieves are incredibly fierce. Last time, you went deep into the mountains and only managed to raid one of their hideouts. Now they're sending you again. Why isn't the second brother going? If you split up, you can quickly eliminate the bandit threat. If we don't, how will everyone get through the harvest season?"

"A wise man doesn't take unnecessary risks. You wouldn't understand," Pei Shuo knew that his younger brother would be the future lord of Jizhou. He couldn't let his younger brother go every time; what if something happened?

But in his heart, he still felt a sense of resentment. They were brothers, after all, and yet in the future, he would have to serve his younger brother. He couldn't help but feel a little unwilling to accept it.

Thinking of this, an incomplete thought formed in his mind, but before that, he had to help his brother clear the obstacles so that he could leave with peace of mind.

In the cold late autumn wind, Zheng Wuheng personally came to see his brother off. Pei Shuo patted his younger brother on the shoulder and said with a smile, "Second brother, go back. Don't see me off. Don't worry; I'll get rid of these bandits as soon as possible. Even if they hide in the mountains or bury themselves underground, I'll dig them out."

Zheng Wuheng whispered to Pei Shuo, "Brother, after you come back this time, you won't have to go again. Next time, I'll lead the troops."

"That’s not an option; you can't leave. You need to guard Jizhou properly." Pei Shuo's eyes turned red. The brothers had always been close, but he couldn’t shake his pride and hated being second to his younger brother.

Zheng Wuheng smiled and said, "We'll talk about it again when you come back."

The two bid farewell. This time, Pei Shuo went to deal with the bandits before the New Year. The bandits appeared to have some kind of expert advising them; they were extremely cunning and used weapons that were very difficult to handle. For example, when arrows were shot, they were blocked by superior shields. These bandits were unlike any he’d faced before. Not only did the mission fail, but it also drained their resources and manpower. When he got back, Zheng Fang gave him a harsh lecture.

Pei Shuo had been fighting battles all year without a break, and even now, as he prepared to leave, he wanted to help his brother eliminate the threats. But he knew his limits. So, he decided to put the half-formed plan into action without wasting any more time.

content:
Chapter 66

◎Second Update◎

The end of the year was always the busiest time, with the estate's rents, various social obligations, and preparations for the festivities at the Huaiyin Mansion. Huiyin wished she could clone herself.

Before, she could still spend time playing with Jing'er, but now she couldn't. With the snowfall, Huiyin couldn't go to see her sons and had to tell Fugui, "I need to go over the accounts today. Please send some easily digestible yam beef soup to the eldest young master and the second young master. Tell their wet nurses to put the children to bed early."

Fugui went down to carry out the order.

Huiyin also remembered the child from the Guo family and had someone send a bowl of walnut mutton soup to them as well. She then continued to bury herself in the accounts. These tasks were familiar, but this year, the merchant family added to the gifts with their generous offering of jewelry. Among them was a crystal string with a jade fish in the center, which she particularly liked.

"I really didn't expect Cao Ping’s sister to be so clever and skillful," Huiyin praised.

Nanny Nan brought ginseng soup and couldn't help but say, "In your eyes, everyone has their virtues."

Huiyin took the ginseng soup, blew on it, and then said, "Nanny, if we only focus on people's weaknesses instead of their strengths, we won't be able to get along with anyone."

"Enough, enough, I can never argue with you," Nanny Nan said, not wanting to engage further as Huiyin drank the soup.

After finishing the ginseng soup, feeling warm, Huiyin yawned and had someone light the lamps to continue reviewing the accounts. She disliked leaving things unfinished overnight. As she worked, the servants didn't dare sleep either. Fugui helped by registering the ledgers, while Linglu and Lingjiu worked on embroidery.

"You all should rest first. I'll be a while longer," she urged the maids.

The maids refused, so Huiyin had them open the snack box to pick and eat what they liked while she continued with the accounts.

Outside, it seemed to be snowing heavily, the flakes as large as goose feathers. She wondered how cold it would be in the morning. Huiyin considered letting Jing'er skip school the next day so the child wouldn't catch a cold.

Even Xuzhou was blanketed in snow, and the capital was hit even harder. De Yin had gradually become less talkative. At this time last year, Lianzhi and Yunzhi would have accompanied her, drinking tea and enjoying the snow. Lianzhi, always the liveliest, had even made a little snowman in front of the door, and everyone had gathered around it, laughing and chatting.

Those days were gone, and everything was lost. Her loneliness seemed unknown to anyone.

Wei Liangdi was no longer as favored. Recently, the Crown Prince was said to be observing a fast and performing rituals for good fortune, and the Emperor's health was deteriorating, making it even harder to see him. A servant in her palace was pregnant and about to give birth. She couldn't afford to openly clash with Yunzhi, or people would say she was unable to control her household.

Thinking of this, De Yin felt sad again.

Yunzhi, however, was happy. In the past, she had to serve others, always standing or kneeling, and even when resting, the room would be heated with harsh black coal. Even as a personal maid, life had been hard. Now, she could comfortably lie on a daybed with a soft pillow behind her and a fine goose-down quilt covering her, feeling warm all over. Even if she were to die immediately, she wouldn't have any regrets.

This was truly a good life. Her life had always been precarious, so losing it now wouldn't be such a big deal. Thinking of poor Lianzhi, Yunzhi felt a pang of sympathy for her.

Touching her belly, she thought that if she could give birth to a son, her life would be better than anything else.

Compared to Huiyin's busyness and De Yin's melancholy, the Zheng family was at a loss.

When Madame Ji read the letter, she couldn't help but want to cry but held back. "It's alright. It's alright. Fortunately, he didn't run off to someone else. The Prince of Huaiyin is our son-in-law, so he's not an outsider."

Zheng Wuheng stood up and said, "Why, brother?" He sat back down, knowing that even as the second-in-command here, there was little chance for great success. If things weren't handled well, he would be scolded.

Life was all about pride. Recently, the Prince of Huaiyin, Li Cheng, had been showing more ambition. He'd already taken Yuzhou and was now setting his sights on Yanzhou.

This is all my fault. I got so frustrated when he couldn't even handle a bunch of bandits that I ended up pushing him away. Zheng Fang protested his innocence, "I can certainly tell what's important. How could I possibly suspect Pei Shuo because of others?"

After all, he was worried that Pei Shuo's growing influence might overshadow his own son. Wasn't it only natural to feel that way?

He didn’t give Pei Shuo any hard time or scold him.

Pei Shuo really wanted to throw in the towel, but in this chaotic world, doing so would only lead to others bullying him. Only with a large territory would there be more money and grain, and only then could he sustain his troops, allowing him to grow stronger.

The Zheng family was left speechless for a moment.

That night, the silence at Huaiyin Mansion was broken by a knock on the door. Li Cheng had imposed a curfew, fearing that without it, the city would be overrun with suspicious characters at night.

At that time, only a special pass signed by him could allow the guards at the city gates to open the doors at night.

That night, the mansion came alive with the sudden glow of lamps. Huiyin was taken aback when she saw Pei Shuo. "Brother, I can't believe it's really you!"

Pei Shuo flashed a wide grin. "Sis, I've come to seek refuge with you."

He thought his sister would ask for reasons, but Huiyin didn’t mention it at all, only saying, "Brother, you’re not here to seek refuge with me; you’re here to make the Prince even stronger. The Prince has been thirsting for talents for years, and since you’re family, he will surely value you greatly in the future."

These words made Pei Shuo feel a wave of relief, rendering the hardships of his journey insignificant.

Huiyin gently patted her nephew's head. "It's late, and everyone's exhausted. Let’s catch up in the morning. You and the kids must be tired from the journey. I’ll settle you in first. Look at your chapped and bleeding lips, brother."

They had endured countless dangers traveling from Jizhou, finally managing to contact Li Cheng on the frontlines, who then arranged for Pei Shuo to settle in Xuzhou first, promising to catch up later when he returned.

Soon, Huiyin had a large courtyard cleaned up and arranged for charcoal braziers and hot water to be delivered, ensuring everyone was well taken care of.

Xin Shi and the others were already exhausted and fell asleep as soon as their heads hit the pillows.

Once they were settled, Huiyin had already pieced together most of what had happened, but she gave Li Cheng the benefit of the doubt. In the past, Empress Dowager Mi had flourished with the help of her brothers. Now, on Li Cheng's territory, apart from bearing an heir, Huiyin was virtually alone and had to rely on emotional bonds with Li Cheng.

In the future, if her brother and she could support each other, she wouldn’t have to live so dependent on her husband’s moods.

However, it was still too early to say these things.

Besides, Li Cheng treated her well, with no issues.

"Tomorrow, have the kitchen prepare two stuffed pig stomachs filled with glutinous rice and lotus seeds, cooked until tender. My brother loves that dish, and it must be done," Huiyin instructed.

After giving her orders, thinking she still had to get up early the next morning, Huiyin lit an incense stick and dozed off.

She slept soundly through the night, and before dawn, Huiyin began checking the ornaments in the storeroom, preparing to send them to her brother. She also had the kitchen prepare breakfast, keeping herself busy.

When Pei Shuo's family of four woke up, Xin Shi received some fur clothes. Nanny Nan said, "This fox fur coat has never been worn by our princess. It’s lined with Zhangzhou velvet. The princess said the south is damp and cold, a cold that seeps into the bones, so she was worried you might not be accustomed to it. This cloak was bought from a Sassanid, and the princess said to let you wear it for novelty. Let’s go to the hall for a meal later."

If Nanny Nan was polite to Xin Shi, she was more familiar with Pei Shuo. "The princess had the pig stomachs stewed overnight, tender and ready for you."

Hearing such warm words, Pei Shuo couldn’t help but be moved and hurriedly brought his wife and children over.

During the meal, Huiyin only urged them to eat and drink and asked how Madame Ji’s health was.

"Since returning from visiting her family, she hasn’t seen her parents for years. I wonder how they’re doing now?"

Thinking of his mother, Pei Shuo felt a pang of regret but also a sense of resolve, thinking a man should take responsibility for his actions and not engage in petty schemes. Thus, he replied calmly, "Our parents are in good health, and your sister-in-law has given birth to a boy. Rest assured."

"Well, that’s good," Huiyin said, not asking further.

Pei Shuo, with an empty stomach, ate two pig stomachs in one go and wiped his mouth with a handkerchief. "This pig stomach is really well-cooked."

"Of course, it was stewed overnight," Huiyin said with a smile, offering a goose fat spring roll to her nephew.

Seeing that the siblings wanted to talk, Xin Shi, understanding the situation, took the children away first.
